thread.title: Lack of Snow Adding Up, Osseo Dealer Reports Shrinking Snowmobile Sales
thread.title_full: Lack of Snow Adding Up, Osseo Dealer Reports Shrinking Snowmobile Sales

author: salain@NWCT.ORG
title: Lack of Snow Adding Up, Osseo Dealer Reports Shrinking Snowmobile Sales
text:
Lack of Snow Adding Up, Osseo Dealer Reports Shrinking Snowmobile Sales
For some, snow means money.
And the lack of the white stuff can impact a business’ bottom line.
“It’s been a little slow. The lack of snow really hasn’t helped,” said Jordan Deutcher with
Heinen Motorsports in Osseo.
Deutcher says snowmobile sales are down 20 percent from a typical year.
Since the local snowmobile base isn’t strong this year, the motorsports store is trying to recoup losses by attracting customers where there is snow.
“We’ve been doing some advertising out West in Colorado, Wyoming, Montana area,” said Deutcher.
Deutcher said he has three snowmobiles that will be delivered on Sunday to Colorado.
The store is also offering deep discounts to sell their snowmobile inventory. It’s also relying on sales of other inventory such as ATVs.
“Four-wheelers and side-by-sides have been selling because people are able to use that while they are out ice fishing,” said Deutcher.
Still Hope for Snow
Steve Reckers, who records data for the National Weather Service at his New Hope home, has been keeping a close eye on snow totals.
Reckers says 33 inches of snow should have fallen by now. However, only 12 inches of snow has fallen this winter season.
He says there’s still time to turn things around.
“Almost half of our normal snowfall comes in February, March, and April, so we could catch up in a hurry,” said Reckers.
It’s a ray of hope for businesses that get a lift from falling snow.
“The snow’s coming, I feel it,” said Deutcher.
Deutcher said many local customers who have bought snowmobiles have trips planned up north where there is snow.
If it feels like it has been a long time without a lot of snow, that’s because you have to go back to 2023, when Minnesota experienced its
third snowiest winter on record.
